001/*

006
007package renderer.pipeline;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011import renderer.framebuffer.*;
012import static renderer.pipeline.PipelineLogger.*;
013
014import java.awt.Color;
015
016/**
017   Rasterize a clipped, textured {@link Triangle} into
018   shaded pixels in the {@link FrameBuffer}'s viewport.
019<p>
020   This rasterization algorithm is based on
021<pre>
022     "Fundamentals of Computer Graphics", 3rd Edition,
023      by Peter Shirley, pages 163-165.
024</pre>
025*/
026public class Rasterize_Triangle
027{
028   /**
029      Rasterize a clipped, textured {@link Triangle} into
030      shaded pixels in the {@link FrameBuffer}'s viewport.
031
032      @param model  {@link Model} that the {@link Triangle} {@code tri} comes from
033      @param tri    {@code Triangle} to rasterize into the {@code FrameBuffer.Viewport}
034      @param vp     {@link FrameBuffer.Viewport} to hold rasterized pixels
035   */
036   public static void rasterize(final Model model,
037                                final Triangle tri,
038                                final FrameBuffer.Viewport vp)
039   {
040      // Make local copies of several values.
041      final int w = vp.getWidthVP();
042      final int h = vp.getHeightVP();
043
044      final int vIndex0 = tri.vIndexList.get(0);
045      final int vIndex1 = tri.vIndexList.get(1);
046      final int vIndex2 = tri.vIndexList.get(2);
047
048      final int cIndex0 = tri.cIndexList.get(0);
049      final int cIndex1 = tri.cIndexList.get(1);
050      final int cIndex2 = tri.cIndexList.get(2);
051
052      final Vertex v0 = model.vertexList.get(vIndex0);
053      final Vertex v1 = model.vertexList.get(vIndex1);
054      final Vertex v2 = model.vertexList.get(vIndex2);
055
056      final float[] c0 = model.colorList.get(cIndex0).getRGBComponents(null);
057      final float[] c1 = model.colorList.get(cIndex1).getRGBComponents(null);
058      final float[] c2 = model.colorList.get(cIndex2).getRGBComponents(null);
059
060      // Get the coordinates for the three vertices.
061      double x0 = v0.x,  y0 = v0.y,  z0 = v0.z;
062      double x1 = v1.x,  y1 = v1.y,  z1 = v1.z;
063      double x2 = v2.x,  y2 = v2.y,  z2 = v2.z;
064
065      // Get the colors for the three vertices.
066      final float r0 = c0[0],  g0 = c0[1],  b0 = c0[2];
067      final float r1 = c1[0],  g1 = c1[1],  b1 = c1[2];
068      final float r2 = c2[0],  g2 = c2[1],  b2 = c2[2];
069
070      // Rasterize a degenerate triangle (a triangle that
071      // projected onto a line) as three line segments.
072      final double area = (x1-x0)*(y2-y0) - (y1-y0)*(x2-x0);
073      if ( 0.00001 > Math.abs(area) ) // 0.0001 causes noticeable artifacts
074      {
075         Rasterize_Line.rasterize(model, new LineSegment(vIndex0, vIndex1, cIndex0, cIndex1), vp);
076         Rasterize_Line.rasterize(model, new LineSegment(vIndex1, vIndex2, cIndex1, cIndex2), vp);
077         Rasterize_Line.rasterize(model, new LineSegment(vIndex2, vIndex0, cIndex2, cIndex0), vp);
078         return;
079      }
080
081      // Transform each vertex to the "pixel plane" coordinate system.
082      x0 = 0.5 + w/2.001 * (x0 + 1); // x_pp = 0.5 + w/2 * (x_p+1)
083      y0 = 0.5 + h/2.001 * (y0 + 1); // y_pp = 0.5 + h/2 * (y_p+1)
084      x1 = 0.5 + w/2.001 * (x1 + 1);
085      y1 = 0.5 + h/2.001 * (y1 + 1);
086      x2 = 0.5 + w/2.001 * (x2 + 1);
087      y2 = 0.5 + h/2.001 * (y2 + 1);
088      // NOTE: Notice the 2.001 fudge factor in the last two equations.
089      // This is explained on page 142 of
090      //    "Jim Blinn's Corner: A Trip Down The Graphics Pipeline"
091      //     by Jim Blinn, 1996, Morgan Kaufmann Publishers.
092
093      // Recall that this triangle's viewport coordinates are in the intervals
094      //     x in (-0.5, vpWidth  - 0.5)
095      //     y in (-0.5, vpHeight - 0.5)
096      // We want to "sample" the triangle (in viewport coordinates)
097      // at the pixel locations with integer coordinates between
098      //     0 and vpWidth - 1
099      //     0 and vpHeight - 1
100      // Our first step is to find a "pixel bounding box" for the triangle.
101      // Each vertex of the triangle is rounded to integer coordinates, and
102      // then we find the left-most, right-most, highest, and lowest integer
103      // coordinates that bound the triangle's vertices.
104
105      // Find the greatest integer less than or equal to x0, x1, and x2.
106      int xMin = (int)x0;
107      if (x1 < xMin) xMin = (int)x1;
108      if (x2 < xMin) xMin = (int)x2;
109      if (xMin == -1) xMin = 0;
110
111      // Find the greatest integer less than or equal to y0, y1, and y2.
112      int yMin = (int)y0;
113      if (y1 < yMin) yMin = (int)y1;
114      if (y2 < yMin) yMin = (int)y2;
115      if (yMin == -1) yMin = 0;
116
117      // Find the least integer greater than or equal to x0, x1, and x2.
118      int xMax = (int)Math.ceil(x0);
119      if (x1 > xMax) xMax = (int)Math.ceil(x1);
120      if (x2 > xMax) xMax = (int)Math.ceil(x2);
121      if (xMax == vp.getWidthVP()) xMax--;
122
123      // Find the least integer greater than or equal to y0, y1, and y2.
124      int yMax = (int)Math.ceil(y0);
125      if (y1 > yMax) yMax = (int)Math.ceil(y1);
126      if (y2 > yMax) yMax = (int)Math.ceil(y2);
127      if (yMax == vp.getHeightVP()) yMax--;
128
129      if (Rasterize.debug)
130      {
131         logMessage(
132            String.format("xMin = %d, xMax = %d, yMin = %d, yMax = %d\n",
133                           xMin,      xMax,      yMin,      yMax));
134      }
135
136    //for (int y = yMin;   y <  yMax; ++y) // bottom to top
137      for (int y = yMax-1; y >= yMin; --y) // top to bottom
138      {
139         for (int x = xMin; x < xMax; ++x) // left to right
140         {
141            //  f01(x,y) = (y0-y1)*(x) + (x1-x0)*(y) + x0*y1 - x1*y0
142            //  f12(x,y) = (y1-y2)*(x) + (x2-x1)*(y) + x1*y2 - x2*y1
143            //  f20(x,y) = (y2-y0)*(x) + (x0-x2)*(y) + x2*y0 - x0*y2
144
145            //  alpha = f12(x,y) / f12(x0,y0)
146            //  beta  = f20(x,y) / f20(x1,y1)
147            //  gamma = f01(x,y) / f01(x2,y2)
148
149            final double alpha = ( (y1-y2)*(x)  + (x2-x1)*(y)  + x1*y2 - x2*y1 )
150                               / ( (y1-y2)*(x0) + (x2-x1)*(y0) + x1*y2 - x2*y1 );
151            final double beta  = ( (y2-y0)*(x)  + (x0-x2)*(y)  + x2*y0 - x0*y2 )
152                               / ( (y2-y0)*(x1) + (x0-x2)*(y1) + x2*y0 - x0*y2 );
153            final double gamma = ( (y0-y1)*(x)  + (x1-x0)*(y)  + x0*y1 - x1*y0 )
154                               / ( (y0-y1)*(x2) + (x1-x0)*(y2) + x0*y1 - x1*y0 );
155
156          //if (Rasterize.debug) logMessage(String.format("alpha=%f,beta=%f,gamma=%f",alpha,beta,gamma));
157
158            // Create a new fragment for the FrameBuffer's viewport.
159            if (alpha >= 0 && beta >= 0 && gamma >= 0)
160            {
161               final int x_vp = x - 1;  // viewport coordinate
162               final int y_vp = h - y;  // viewport coordinate
163
164               // Interpolate z-coordinate from the triangle's vertices to this fragment.
165               final double zCoord = (alpha * z0) + (beta * z1) + (gamma * z2);
166
167               // Get the z-buffer value currently at this pixel of the viewport.
168               final double zBuff = vp.getDepthVP(x_vp, y_vp);
169
170               // If the current fragment is in front of the pixel in the framebuffer,
171               // then overwrite the pixel in the framebuffer with this fragment.
172               if (zCoord > zBuff)
173               {
174                  // Interpolate color data from the triangle's vertices to this fragment.
175                  float r = (float)( (alpha * r0) + (beta * r1) + (gamma * r2) );
176                  float g = (float)( (alpha * g0) + (beta * g1) + (gamma * g2) );
177                  float b = (float)( (alpha * b0) + (beta * b1) + (gamma * b2) );
178
179                  if (Rasterize.doGamma)
180                  {
181                     // Apply gamma-encoding (gamma-compression) to the colors.
182                     // https://www.scratchapixel.com/lessons/digital-imaging/digital-images
183                     // http://blog.johnnovak.net/2016/09/21/what-every-coder-should-know-about-gamma/
184                     final double gammaInv = 1.0 / Rasterize.GAMMA;
185                     r = (float)Math.pow(r, gammaInv);
186                     g = (float)Math.pow(g, gammaInv);
187                     b = (float)Math.pow(b, gammaInv);
188                  }
189
190                  if (tri.textured)
191                  {
192                     final int tcIndex0 = tri.tcIndexList.get(0);
193                     final int tcIndex1 = tri.tcIndexList.get(1);
194                     final int tcIndex2 = tri.tcIndexList.get(2);
195
196                     // Get the texture coordinates for the three vertices.
197                     final double s0 = model.texCoordList.get( tcIndex0 ).s;
198                     final double t0 = model.texCoordList.get( tcIndex0 ).t;
199                     final double s1 = model.texCoordList.get( tcIndex1 ).s;
200                     final double t1 = model.texCoordList.get( tcIndex1 ).t;
201                     final double s2 = model.texCoordList.get( tcIndex2 ).s;
202                     final double t2 = model.texCoordList.get( tcIndex2 ).t;
203
204                     // Interpolate texture coordinates from the triangle's vertices to this fragment.
205                     double s = alpha * s0 + beta * s1 + gamma * s2;
206                     double t = alpha * t0 + beta * t1 + gamma * t2;
207
208                     s = s - Math.floor(s);  // wrap the texture in both the
209                     t = t - Math.floor(t);  // s and t coordinate directions
210                                             // for both pos and neg texture coordinates
211
212//                   s = s - (int)s;  // wrap the texture in both the
213//                   t = t - (int)t;  // s and t coordinate directions
214
215                     //System.err.printf("s = %f, t = %f\n", s, t);
216
217                     // Get this triangle's texture.
218                     final Texture tex = model.textureList.get(tri.textureIndex);
219
220                     // Convert (interpolated) texture coordinates into pixel indices.
221                     final int xTex = (int)(s * (tex.width - 1));   // column index
222                     final int yTex = (int)(t * (tex.height - 1));  // row index
223
224                     // Get color data from the texture.
225                     final int index = (yTex * tex.width) + xTex;
226                     final int color = tex.pixel_buffer[index];
227                     final Color c = new Color(color);
228                     final float rT = c.getRed() / 255.0f;
229                     final float gT = c.getGreen() / 255.0f;
230                     final float bT = c.getBlue() / 255.0f;
231                     final float alphaT = tex.alpha_buffer[index] / 255.0f;
232
233                     // Blend the texture's color data with the pixel's color data.
234                     r = (1.0f - alphaT) * r + (alphaT * rT);
235                     g = (1.0f - alphaT) * g + (alphaT * gT);
236                     b = (1.0f - alphaT) * b + (alphaT * bT);
237                  }
238
239                  if (Rasterize.debug) logPixel((double)x, (double)y, x_vp, y_vp, r, g, b, vp);
240                  // Log the pixel before setting it so that an array out-
241                  // of-bounds error will be right after the pixel's address.
242
243                  vp.setPixelVP(x_vp, y_vp, new Color(r, g, b));
244                  vp.setDepthVP(x_vp, y_vp, zCoord);
245               }
246            }
247         }
248      }
249   }
250
251
252
253   // Private default constructor to enforce noninstantiable class.
254   // See Item 4 in "Effective Java", 3rd Ed, Joshua Bloch.
255   private Rasterize_Triangle() {
256      throw new AssertionError();
257   }
258}
